name: Scrambled Eggs and Shrimp
author: Cathy Shaw Ardman
summary: I made this on a whim. I just had these things on hand. This is a wonderful combination of eggs, cocktail sauce, and shrimp.  It is an interesting mixture of tastes that you wouldn't think would go together, but they do. This goes together very quickly, if you have everything ready to go. This sauce becomes sweet when you cook it. Also I made my own cocktail sauce, but you could use a pre-made sauce. You can cook the eggs in butter instead of oil if desired. Garnish with lemon and parsley.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed
directions: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; saute onion until translucent, 5 to 10 minutes
Add eggs to onion and season with salt
Cook and stir until eggs are set, about 5 minutes
Stir shrimp and cocktail sauce into eggs; cook until warm, 3 to 4 minutes
